column5: Headed out to the grand last night in hopes of getting some perch and walleye, no perch to be had at the pier   and the eyes werent to active either, water was pretty high and the winds this am didnt help matters  out of the 5 fish I caught 2 were upgrades for Team 7  managed a 31" channel cat while trolling, it was the ugliest catfish I have ever caught, it really sucks to find out you left your pliers behind when you have to pry the mouth of one of these guys open to get your lure back    also got a nice eye while trolling, I thought I had another cat the way it was tugging    while I was trolling along I noticed something swimming in the water, when I got closer I could tell it was a deer, must of needed some tackle since it was headed straight for the bait shop      going out again next Sunday for fathers day, hopefully the eyes are a little more cooperative to keep my son occupied
Nice Job Brifishrgy...The perch should be there once the mouth of the river clears up a bit.  Hopefully in the next few days if the rain would lay off.  Cheers  Craig
nice eye man. what section of the grand was that?
It looks like the stretch from Dunville down to Port Maitland.
Monster fish, great catches. Got to try some cat fishn' some day!  Thanks for the report, MTBF
